intro: Echinocarpus sinensis, commonly known as the Chinese spiky sida, is a flowering plant belonging to the Malvaceae family. It is characterized by its distinctive spiny fruits, which are typically spherical and covered in small, sharp projections. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers that are clustered in dense inflorescences. Native to Asia, it thrives in tropical and subtropical climates. Its botanical features make it an interesting subject for both horticultural and ecological studies.
